passage_text: Answer by jsmith (2067). Ovarian infections are incredibly rare, but the the most common symptom is lower pelvic pain and flank pain. Unfortunately, this symptom is common to urinary tract infections, ovarian cysts, yeast infections, and a whole host of other problems.
Some symptoms of an ovarian infection are: fever, lower pain in the abdomen, a dark vaginal discharge, and general pain and weakness that is common with infection is present. add a comment.

Ovarian cancer may cause several signs and symptoms. Women are more likely to have symptoms if the disease has spread beyond the ovaries, but even early-stage ovarian cancer can cause them. The most common symptoms include: 1  Bloating. 2  Pelvic or abdominal pain.

Answer by DrMom (854). The most common symptom of ovarian infection is severe pain but it may also be accompanied by nausea, vomiting, chills, fever, and fainting-all caused by the severity of the pain. Women suffering from these symptoms must seek medical attention. Untreated ovarian infection can cause scarring and possible infertility.

Ovarian cancer may cause one or more of these signs and symptoms—. 1  Vaginal bleeding or discharge from your vagina that is not normal for you. 2  Pain in the pelvic or abdominal area (the area below your stomach and between your hip bones). 3  Back pain. 4  Bloating, which is when the area below your stomach swells or feels full.
